text: I condemn the invasion of my motherland Russia into Ukraine and the attacks of Azerbaijan on my fatherland Armenia.
I am a software researcher and engineer.

I recently joined the Network Nervous System (NNS) team at the DFINITY Foundation and am the owner of the scalability testing framework for the Service Nervous System, a blueprint for decentralizing Web3 applications. I have also been driving the code-level verification initiative resulting in the Motoko-san prototype. Before joining the NNS team, I worked on several cross-team projects, e.g., distributed system testing and formal policy monitoring.

I obtained my doctoral degree from Prof.~Peter~M√ºller's Programming Methodology Group at ETH~Zurich. During my doctoral studies, my research was focused on developing scalable and precise automated formal reasoning techniques and programmer-friendly tools for formal verification.

Before joining ETH, I was a Research Scientist at Intel's Strategic CAD Lab, developing tools for automatic power & performance debugging in mobile systems. I also worked on compilers, applying machine learning for automatically tuning compiler optimizations, and have designed a novel optimization for an explicitly parallel computer architecture.

children.name: Viper
text: I used to be a member of the team developing Viper, an intermediate language and the infrastructure for SMT-automated deductive formal verification. My focus was on extending Viper's specification features, enabling modular verification of heap reachability and comprehensions (data structure aggregations). Additionally, I used to be the maintainer of Viper~IDE.
